en: Hans could feel his heart hammering in his chest. So hard it made his hands shake as he worked at the lock.
zh: 漢斯可以感到他的胸口一陣狂跳，以至於他開鎖的雙手在不停地顫抖。

en: Picking locks was one of his things. Shaky hands was not.
zh: 撬鎖是他的專長，但是，雙手顫抖並不是。

en: He was excited, not nervous.
zh: 他很興奮，一點兒也不緊張。

en: He once told his friend Jerry that a long time ago.
zh: 很久以前，他就這麼告訴過他的朋友傑瑞。

en: The problem is you don’t get the same feel when you’re wearing gloves—that millimeter of latex numbing the senses and making the tumblers feel half the size they really are.
zh: 問題是，當你戴著手套，觸感就不一樣了，隔著乳膠，感覺鎖就只有真實的一半大小。

en: But he knew what he was doing, and it was only a matter of time.
zh: 他知道他在做什麼，這不過是時間問題罷了。

en: Less than two minutes later there was a soft click and something in the lock went slack, then tightened again.
zh: 不到兩分鐘，耳畔響起輕微的咔嗒聲，鎖中的什麼東西鬆動了一下，然後再次收緊。

en: He breathed deep. Nobody could see him.
zh: 他深吸了一口氣，沒有人看到他。

en: It was a clear night and there was a half-moon hanging right above him, eliminating the need for a flashlight.
zh: 這是一個晴朗的夜晚，天空懸挂著一輪皎潔的明月，襯得他手電筒發射的光暗淡昏黃，也就沒有必要用了。

en: He could see a million stars, and looking out at them made the night feel timeless, it made him feel tiny.
zh: 百萬顆星星彷彿讓今夜化作永恆，看著它們，讓他覺得自己無比渺小。

en: He could taste the air.
zh: 他品嘗著清新的空氣。

en: He opened the door, the interior a black hole the light from the moon couldn’t penetrate.
zh: 打開門，他看到裏面猶如黑洞，月亮的光線照不進去。

en: Ever since he saw the girl at Jerry’s house a week ago he knew he had to have her. Knew he had to have some up close and personal time with her.
zh: 自從一個星期前他在傑瑞家看到那個女孩，他就知道他必須佔有她，知道他必須和她親密無間。

en: Poor Jerry. He really messed up that wedding.
zh: 可憐的傑瑞，他真的搞砸了婚禮。

en: Hans would rather die than go through what his friend was experiencing.
zh: 漢斯寧願死去，也不願體驗他朋友的經歷。

en: Hans thought about it as he made his way back to the car.
zh: 漢斯一邊朝車前走，心裏一邊盤算著。

en: And the more he thought about it, the more he began to see an opportunity.
zh: 越是這麼想，越是覺得這是個千載難逢的好機會。

en: He had been careful not to leave any evidence behind—he knew how to clean up a crime scene, but of course sometimes you just got unlucky.
zh: 他做事很謹慎，知道如何清理犯罪現場，所以沒有留下絲毫證據，但總有不走運的時候。

en: If the police had a solid suspect that wasn’t him . . . well now, wouldn’t that be a wonderful thing.
zh: 如果警察有充分的理由認為嫌疑犯不是他……現在好了，這難道不是件好事嗎？

en: He rang Jerry back.
zh: 他給傑瑞回電話。

en: Jerry was happy to hear from him.
zh: 接到他的電話，傑瑞很高興。

en: He told Jerry he would be there soon, and to meet him outside once he pulled up.
zh: 他告訴傑瑞他馬上就到。他需要停下車，在外面見他。

en: He had learned that from Jerry’s books.
zh: 這是他在傑瑞的書中學到的。

en: The key was to make Jerry come to the conclusion he himself was a killer.
zh: 關鍵是得讓傑瑞得出結論：他自己是殺人兇手。

en: The key was to make Jerry try to hide the evidence, which would only serve to make him look guiltier.
zh: 因此他得讓傑瑞隱藏證據，這隻會使他看起來更有罪。

en: Hans still had the knife. It didn’t have his prints on it.
zh: 漢斯還留著刀，但上面沒有他的任何印記。

en: The plan had been to dump it into a deep hole forever, but now the plan was changing. Evolving.
zh: 原計劃是把它丟進一個深洞的，但現在計劃變了。

en: What did it matter if the world thought he was a killer?
zh: 傑瑞的日子到頭了，要是全世界的人都認為他是個殺人兇手，那會怎樣呢？

en: He drove to the house where Jerry was waiting.
zh: 他開車去那幢房子，傑瑞正在那裡等他。

en: Not much had changed in the thirty years since he was last here, or maybe it had and he just didn’t give a shit.
zh: 他最後一次來這裡是三十年前的事了，這裏幾乎沒有什麼變化，有點兒變化他也毫不關心。

en: He parked outside the old house and Jerry came walking down the pathway to the car with that stupid dopey look Jerry has these days.
zh: 他把車停在老房子的外面，傑瑞沿著小徑迎面走來，獃頭獃腦的。

en: There was an overweight woman watching from the doorway and that was a loose end, but not one he felt needed taking care of immediately.
zh: 一個胖女人站在門口向這邊張望，顯然，她是閑得慌，他覺得沒有必要在意她。

en: He would see where things went.
zh: 他只需要關注事情正在朝著什麼方向發展。

en: Jerry climbed into the car, thanked him, and then . . .
zh: 傑瑞上了車，感謝他，然後…

en: then nothing.
zh: …然後什麼也沒說。

en: His friend was switching off again, wasn’t he?
zh: 他的朋友腦子關機了，不是嗎？

en: “Jerry?
zh: 「傑瑞？

en: Hey, Jerry, are you with me?”
zh: 傑瑞，你現在還清醒嗎？」

en: Jerry was walking the fields and shitting in the woods of Batshit County, population: Jerry.
zh: 傑瑞走在田野里，在瘋人縣的樹林里拉屎。

en: He drove the rest of the way to Jerry’s house, but pulled up twenty yards short.
zh: 他驅車去傑瑞家，但在相距二十米的地方停了下來。

en: He didn’t want to risk waking Sandra.
zh: 他不想冒險驚醒桑德拉。

en: He climbed out of the car and came around to Jerry’s side.
zh: 他打開車門出來，到了傑瑞身邊。

en: His friend was in a state somewhere between consciousness and sleep. He allowed Hans to lead him to the house.
zh: 他的朋友處於半夢半醒的狀態，漢斯領著他向家裡走去。

en: Hans could feel Jerry switch into some kind of automatic mode. He climbed through the office window and sat on the couch.
zh: 漢斯可以感覺傑瑞的大腦切換到某種自動模式，他爬過寫作房的窗戶，坐在沙發上。

en: At that point Hans could do anything he wanted, so what he did was sit down and think things through.
zh: 那一刻，漢斯可以為所欲為，所以他坐了下來，好把事件想清楚。

en: He went out to the car and brought in the murder weapon.
zh: 他回到車上，拿來兇器。

en: Jerry was asleep.
zh: 傑瑞睡著了。

en: He wiped blood from the knife onto Jerry’s shirt, then dropped the knife into the pocket of Jerry’s jacket after putting Jerry’s prints all over it.
zh: 他把刀子上的血擦到傑瑞的襯衫上，然後把傑瑞的指印按在刀上，再將刀放進傑瑞的外套口袋。

en: Then he left.
zh: 他離開了。

en: He felt sure Sandra would be calling the police by the end of the day.
zh: 他確信桑德拉會在這一天結束時打電話給警察。

en: She would see Jerry’s shirt covered in blood. She would find the knife. She would turn in her husband.
zh: 她將會看到傑瑞的襯衫上的血跡，她將會發現刀，她將會告發她的丈夫。

en: Hell, maybe Jerry would kill his wife too, and that’d be the icing on the cake because the bitch never has liked Hans.
zh: 也許傑瑞會殺了他的妻子，這真是錦上添花，這婊子向來不喜歡漢斯。

en: Useful Jerry. That’s who he is now.
zh: 傑瑞還是有利用價值的，這就是現在的他。

en: He flicks back through the story, a story he can’t remember writing, a story Henry went and penned all by himself.
zh: 他讀完這個故事，一個他不記得寫的故事，一個亨利完成的故事。

en: His heart is hammering again, it hammers hard then skips a few beats and then hammers some more.
zh: 他的心臟再次狂跳起來，然後間歇性地停了幾秒，再次狂跳起來。

en: He feels light-headed.
zh: 他感到頭暈目眩。

en: It’s a story, he thinks. Just a story, prefaced with the words A short story. It doesn’t say A short essay. It doesn’t say A witness statement.
zh: 這隻是一個故事，他心想，只是一個故事，開頭就寫著「短篇小說」，並不是紀實，不是證詞，只是短篇小說而已，這是他們編造的，是虛構的，是他和亨利的「傑作」——他們本來就是編造的藝術家。

en: It says short story, because it’s fiction, because it’s made up, because that’s what he and Henry do—they are makeup artists. And in this case, one of those makeup artists has gotten carried away with things, but that’s Henry’s thing, the same way Hans’s thing is picking locks (maybe) and killing women (maybe) and how Jerry is a dessert guy (definitely). But it’s also Henry’s thing to find the truth in a lie. It could have gone that way.
zh: 既然是這樣，那就是亨利因一時興奮而忘乎所以，缺乏對事情的謹慎思考，就像亨利發現了漢斯撬鎖（可能）和殺害女人（可能），以及傑瑞愛吃甜點（絕對）。

en: Jerry could have woken, found himself wearing the shirt Hans had bloodied, then hidden it before going back to sleep.
zh: 但是，亨利同樣也可以在謊言中發現真相。很有可能會是這樣：傑瑞醒來后，發現自己穿著漢斯沾上血跡的襯衫，他把它藏了起來，再回去睡覺。

en: Or none of it happened. He killed the florist and he killed his wife and the Alzheimer’s is trying to protect him from the truth.
zh: 也有可能，什麼都沒發生過；也有可能，他殺死了花店老闆，殺死了他的妻子，阿爾茨海默病正要幫他掩蓋真相。

en: Jerry looks over at his friend. Hans is staring at him, a hardened look on his face.
zh: 傑瑞盯著漢斯，漢斯也盯著傑瑞，神色肅穆。

en: He gets the sense Hans has been watching him for a while now.
zh: 他知道漢斯已經盯著他有一段時間了。

en: “I’m fine,” he says, but he’s not fine.
zh: 小心。「我很好。」他說，但他一點兒都不好。

en: It’s all coming together now.
zh: 現在，所有的事情都聯繫在一起了。

en: Don’t trust Hans, because Hans is a psychopath.
zh: 不要相信漢斯，因為漢斯是一個瘋子。

en: “Nothing much,” Jerry says, and he flicks his gaze to the arm of the couch where the gun he found earlier is resting.
zh: 傑瑞說，他把目光投向沙發扶手，剛才找到的槍就放在那裡。

en: It’s the quickest of glances, but Hans must notice it too.
zh: 只是快速的一瞥，但漢斯一定注意到了。

en: He points the gun at Jerry and shakes the journal with his other hand.
zh: 他用槍指著傑瑞，另一隻手晃了晃日記。

en: Either way, it all ends here, buddy.
zh: 不管怎麼樣，一切都結束了，夥計。

en: I just needed the journal.”
zh: 我只需要日記。」

en: “You killed Sandra,” Jerry says. “You killed the florist too.”
zh: 傑瑞說：「你殺了桑德拉，你還殺了花店老闆。」

en: “You were close to figuring it out in here,” Hans says, still holding the journal, “but what I don’t understand is why you tore out those pages.
zh: 「你快找到真相啦。」漢斯說，他手裡仍然拿著日記，「但是我不明白你為什麼要撕掉這幾頁。那上面寫了些什麼？」

en: “You killed Sandra,” Jerry says, ignoring the question.
zh: 「你殺了桑德拉。」傑瑞說，他沒有理會這個問題。

en: He starts to get up from the desk. “Jesus, the girl from all those years ago! Suzan with a z. That was you as well?”
zh: 他從辦公桌前站起身來，「天啊，許多年前的那個女孩，那個蘇姍，也是你殺的？」

en: “She was the first.
zh: 「她是第一個。

en: Don’t move any further, Jerry.”
zh: 別再說了，傑瑞。」

en: Jerry shakes his head. He feels sick.
zh: 傑瑞搖搖頭，他覺得噁心。

en: This man has been his friend for thirty years. They’ve studied together, commiserated together, celebrated together, drunk and laughed and partied and talked all kinds of shit in all kinds of states together. His friend.
zh: 這個風風雨雨三十年的朋友，他們一起學習，互相慰藉，把酒言歡，侃天說地，談古論今。

en: “How many have there been?”
zh: 「還有幾個？」

en: he asks.
zh: 他問。

en: “What does it matter?” Hans asks.
zh: 「那重要嗎？」漢斯問。

en: “You’re insane.”
zh: 「你瘋了。」

en: Hans shrugs. “Really?
zh: 漢斯聳聳肩，笑了：「真的嗎？

en: All those things you write about, and now with the Alzheimer’s messing with you, you’re calling me the insane one?”
zh: 你寫了所有東西，現在你又得了阿爾茨海默病，你說我是瘋子？」

en: Hans laughs.
zh: 漢斯放聲笑了起來：

en: “I don’t understand,” Jerry says.
zh: 「我不明白。」傑瑞說，「你今天為什麼幫我？」

en: “I wasn’t planning on it,” Hans says.
zh: 「本來沒有這個打算的。」漢斯說，「我想帶你去警局。」

en: “But you changed your mind.”
zh: 「但你改變了主意。」

en: “I had to, once you’d mentioned the journal.
zh: 「肯定的，因為你提到了日記。

en: Jerry thinks back to earlier this afternoon.
zh: 傑瑞回想起今天下午發生的事。

en: They were only a few blocks from the police station when everything changed.
zh: 他們離警察局只有幾條街，後來，一切都改變了。

en: That must have been when he told Hans about the journal.
zh: 一定是因為他告訴漢斯關於日記的事。

en: “What about Eric?
zh: 「艾瑞克是怎麼回事？

en: What was all that about?
zh: 到底是怎麼回事？

en: Did he really do those things?”
zh: 他真的做那些事情了嗎？」

en: “Eric? Of course he did.
zh: 「艾瑞克？他當然做了。

en: Jerry looks at the gun. Then he thinks about the knife on the desk and has to make a conscious effort not to look in its direction.
zh: 傑瑞看著槍，他想起了桌上的刀，他必須有意識地控制住自己，不要朝那個方向看。

en: If he can just get to it . . .
zh: 要是他能摸到刀的話……

en: And what?
zh: 「又能怎樣？

en: “So now what?
zh: 「那現在是怎麼回事？

en: You’re framing me for the bad things you’ve done too?
zh: 你想把你做的壞事嫁禍給我？

en: Just like he did?”
zh: 就像他一樣？」

en: “Hey, it was a good plan,” Hans says.
zh: 「嘿，這是一個好主意。」

en: “You shot Sandra.”
zh: 「是你開槍打死了桑德拉？」

en: “I did.”
zh: 「沒錯，是我乾的。」

en: “Why can’t I remember that?”
zh: 「我為什麼不記得？」

en: “I drugged you,” he says.
zh: 「我給你下了葯。」

en: “I came over that day after you called me, and injected you when we were in the office. I had to.
zh: 他說，「那天，你給我打電話，我就過來了，我們在寫作房時，我就給你注射了麻醉劑，我不得不這樣做。

en: I knew eventually you’d figure it out.
zh: 我知道最終你會弄清楚的。

en: Hell, I should have known the blood on the shirt was a mistake.
zh: 媽的，我早就知道襯衫上的血是個錯誤。

en: Jerry tries to picture the moment, but there’s nothing.
zh: 傑瑞回想那一刻，但什麼也沒有想起來。

en: This man who was supposed to look out for him betrayed him.
zh: 這個本應照顧他的人卻背叛了他。

en: Just like Eric.
zh: 就像艾瑞克一樣。

en: “There’s no way you can get away with this,” Jerry says.
zh: 「你逃不掉的。」傑瑞說。

en: I think he’s doing just that.
zh: 「我認為他正打算這樣做。」

en: Why couldn’t Henry have warned him?
zh: 為什麼亨利不提醒他？

en: Doesn’t he always connect the dots?
zh: 他不是總能明了全局嗎？

en: You’re not the only one the Alzheimer’s is affecting, buddy.
zh: 「你不是唯一一個受阿爾茨海默病折磨的人，夥計。

en: And I did try to warn you.
zh: 我的確警告過你。」

en: He did. But it was a little late.
zh: 他的確警告過他，但為時已晚。

en: “What are you going to do?
zh: 「你打算怎麼辦？

en: Shoot me in here?
zh: 打死我嗎？然

en: Then what?
zh: 後呢？

en: The police are going to come here and they’ll figure it out.”
zh: 警察就會來這裏，他們會調查清楚的。」

en: Hans smiles again. “All these years you kept coming to me for advice. You kept wanting to know how things work.
zh: 漢斯又微微一笑：「這些年來，你一直在找我幫你出主意，想知道如何犯罪和偵察。

en: You made shitloads of money off the help I gave you, and what did I get in return?
zh: 因為我的幫助，你賺了很多錢，可我得到了什麼？

en: Jerry thinks for second, wonders if these words could possibly be true.
zh: 傑瑞思忖片刻，心想這些話可能都是真的。

en: “What the hell does that even mean?”
zh: 「你又是什麼意思？」

en: “It means your life has been over since the diagnosis, Jerry, but I’ve still got a lot of living left to do. Good living.
zh: 「這意味著診斷出來后，你的生命就結束了，傑瑞，但我還要過生活，追求美好的生活。

en: I get to carry on with my life, and this shitty existence of yours gets to come to an end.
zh: 我繼續我的生活，而你的生命就已經結束了。

en: Or I shoot you right now and drive to her house.”
zh: 要不然，我現在就開槍打死你，再開車去她家。」

en: “You son of—”
zh: 「你這個渾蛋——」

en: “Don’t,” Hans says, when Jerry starts to get out of the chair.
zh: 「不要這樣。」漢斯說，傑瑞開始從椅子上站起身來，「不要動，你聽我把話說完。」

en: “Then don’t make me.
zh: 「那你就不要逼我。

en: You write a confession, you take the easy way out, and I don’t go and—”
zh: 你寫一份懺悔書，然後一了百了，我就不去——」「不要說了。」

en: “I’ll make sure she knows you’re the reason I have to hurt her.
zh: 「我一定會讓她知道你是我傷害她的原因。

en: But you can save her, Jerry. Right here, right now.”
zh: 但是，你可以救她，傑瑞，此時此刻。」

en: “You won’t get away with it. The police will know you did it.”
zh: 「你不會得逞的，你不會有好結果的，警察會知道一切都是你乾的。」

en: “Maybe they’ll figure it out, maybe they won’t.
zh: 「也許他們會查出來，也許他們查不出來。

en: What is certain is Eva will be dead. You have nothing left, Jerry.
zh: 但可以肯定的是，伊娃就要死了，而你什麼都沒有留下，傑瑞。

en: But you can do this for her. You can save her.”
zh: 你可以為她做件事，你可以救她。」

en: Jerry begins to say something then realizes he doesn’t know what.
zh: 傑瑞開始說著什麼，隨後他察覺到他並不知道自己說了些什麼。

en: His mouth is dry. His heart is hammering again, and soon it won’t be able to hammer anymore.
zh: 他的嘴巴乾澀，心臟再次狂跳，但很快就平息了。

en: “You want me to shoot myself,” he says.
zh: 「你想讓我開槍打死自己？」他說。

en: “It’s as simple as it sounds,” Hans says.
zh: 「這很簡單。」漢斯說。

en: “You confess to a few things on my behalf,” Hans says, “and I promise I’ll never see Eva again.
zh: 「你以自己的名義坦承幾件事。」漢斯說，「我保證我以後永遠不會再見伊娃，我向你保證。

en: You have my word. You don’t do this, and I’m going to kill her, and I’m going to have myself some fun while doing it, just like I did with the florist.”
zh: 要是你不這樣做，我就去找她，我要好好享受一番，再殺死她，就像我殺花店老闆時那樣。」

en: “You really are a chump, Jerry.
zh: 「我又沒有殺過人！」「你真是個蠢貨，傑瑞。

en: No, you haven’t, but you will be killing Eva if you don’t do what I ask.”
zh: 是的，你沒有，但如果你不按照我的要求做，你就會殺死伊娃。」

en: It doesn’t require any thought.
zh: 不需要做任何思考。

en: In fact, from the moment Hans mentioned Eva’s name he knew where this was going.
zh: 事實上，當漢斯提到伊娃名字的那一刻，他就知道這是怎麼回事了。

en: There is no choice. It’s what any parent would do. Die to protect their child.
zh: 他別無選擇，任何一個父親都會這樣做，犧牲自己去保護孩子。

en: “What do you want me to say?”
zh: 「你想讓我說什麼？」

en: “You’re the writer, I’m sure you can come up with something.
zh: 「你是作家，我相信你總能想出辦法。

en: Think of it as your greatest work of fiction.”
zh: 好好想想，把這當作你最後一部偉大的小說。」

en: Jerry starts to nod.
zh: 傑瑞點點頭。

en: “Okay,” he says.
zh: 「好吧。」

en: “First I need to know what happened.
zh: 他說，「首先我需要知道發生了什麼。

en: That day with Sandra. I need you to tell me.”
zh: 那一天跟桑德拉在一起時，我需要你告訴我。」

en: “Why?
zh: 「幹什麼？

en: It won’t do you any good to hear it.”
zh: 知道了對你沒什麼好處。」

en: “Please. I have to know.”
zh: 「求求你了，我必須知道。」

en: Hans shrugs, like it’s no big deal.
zh: 漢斯聳聳肩，好像說了這些也沒什麼大不了的。

en: “She figured it out,” he says, “and looking through those final few pages, you almost figured it out too.
zh: 「她發現了。」他說，「看看最後幾頁，你也差不多知道了。

en: In fact I think you did. That’s what’s in those loose pages, isn’t it?
zh: 我認為你知道的，那些零散的幾張紙上寫著呢，對吧？

en: They’re from the diary, aren’t they?”
zh: 它們原來是日記上的，對嗎？」

en: “It’s a journal,” Jerry says, “and yes.”
zh: 傑瑞說：「哦，是的。」

en: “Why did you rip them out?”
zh: 「你為什麼要把那幾頁撕掉？」

en: When Jerry doesn’t answer, Hans starts to smile. He carries on. “You don’t remember ripping them out, do you?”
zh: 傑瑞沒有回答，漢斯瘋笑起來，他說：「你不記得撕下來了，是嗎？」

en: “I think Henry tore them out.”
zh: 「我想是亨利撕掉的。」

en: “What?”
zh: 「什麼？」

en: Jerry doesn’t feel like explaining it.
zh: 傑瑞不想解釋。

en: But he thinks Henry was tearing them out because Henry was just as crazy as Jerry, and when you’re the king of Mount Crazy, you do things that don’t make sense.
zh: 但是，他認為是亨利撕毀的，因為亨利和傑瑞一樣瘋了，做什麼都是沒有意義的。

en: Maybe Henry was trying to protect him somehow. Maybe Henry tore them out because he knew the journal would end up in the wrong hands. He had to save what he thought was important.
zh: 也許是亨利在保護他，也許亨利想撕掉那幾頁，是因為他知道日記最終會落到壞人手中的，他必須保存他認為最重要的東西。

en: Whatever the reason, Jerry thinks it doesn’t really matter.
zh: 不管出於什麼原因，傑瑞認為這並不重要。

en: Not now. Not when there’s a loaded gun pointing at him.
zh: 至少，現在並不重要，因為一把上了膛的槍正指著他。

en: Instead of answering Hans, he asks again what happened with Sandra.
zh: 他沒有回答漢斯，而是再次問他桑德拉發生了什麼事。

en: “We were in your office,” Hans says. “The gun was still on your desk.
zh: 「那天，我們在你的寫作房，」漢斯說，「槍還在你的桌上。

en: You asked me again about the blood on the shirt. You told me Sandra had spoken to the nurse. You and Sandra were confused because the events didn’t line up.
zh: 你再次向我打探襯衫上的血，你告訴我桑德拉和護士交談過了，你和桑德拉很不解，因為事情說不通。

en: The nurse hadn’t seen blood on your shirt, and the time of death for the florist suggested you were innocent.
zh: 護士沒有在你的襯衫上看到血，而花店老闆的死亡時間表明你是無辜的。

en: You went to the office door to call to Sandra, and as soon as your back was to me I injected you in the neck.
zh: 你到寫作房門口，去叫桑德拉，你背對著我時，我就在你脖子上打了一針。

en: A few seconds later you were out cold.
zh: 幾秒鐘后，你渾身冰冷。

en: I laid you on the couch, then just waited until Sandra came in. She rushed over to you and I closed the door behind her.
zh: 我把你放在沙發上，然後等著桑德拉進來，她衝到你身邊，我關上她身後的門。

en: She looked up at me and I could tell she had figured it out.
zh: 她抬頭看著我，我明白她全知道了。

en: She had that same look on her face you had a few minutes ago.”
zh: 她臉上的表情和幾分鐘前你臉上的表情一樣。」

en: “You asked her what she knew?”
zh: 「你問她她都知道了什麼？」

en: “There was no point.
zh: 「沒有意義。

en: I knew that she knew, and she knew that I knew that she knew.
zh: 我知道她知道了，她也知道我知道她知道了。

en: One shot to the chest, that’s all it took.
zh: 一槍擊中胸部。這就是所發生的一切。

en: Soundproofing really is a wonderful thing, Jerry.”
zh: 隔音裝置真的很奇妙，傑瑞。」

en: Jerry can feel himself coming apart at the seams.
zh: 傑瑞覺得自己瀕於崩潰邊緣了。

en: All of this started that night at the party when he said this is my wife . . .
zh: 所有這一切都是從晚上那場派對開始的，當時，他說：「這是我妻子……」

en: and couldn’t remember Sandra’s name.
zh: 卻忽然記不得桑德拉的名字了。

en: That image is as clear as it was the day it happened. It means that right now he’s having the worst good day he’s had since being diagnosed. The disease allowed him to forget Sandra’s name, it allowed Hans and Eric to take advantage of him.
zh: 那情景恍然如昨，那是他被確診后度過的最糟糕的一天，疾病讓他忘了桑德拉的名字，讓漢斯和艾瑞克能盡情利用他。

en: Sandra, dead because of an illness for which there is no cure.
zh: 桑德拉死了，因為一種無法治愈的疾病。

en: All of this because the Universe is punishing him.
zh: 所有這一切，都是因為上蒼在懲罰他。

en: But what for?
zh: 但為什麼呢？

en: If not for killing, then for what?
zh: 他又不曾殺過人，那麼是為什麼呢？

en: The answer comes to him quickly.
zh: 很快他想到了答案。

en: It’s because he did the one thing he swore he would never do —he based a character on a real person. Suzan with a z.
zh: 這是因為他打破了自己的誓言：他根據一個真實人物塑造了角色：那個把「珊」寫成「姍」的蘇姍。

en: She was a real person with a real family and real feelings, and he betrayed that.
zh: 她是一個真實存在過的人，有屬於自己的家庭和感情。

en: He turned what happened to her into a story. He wrote about it for entertainment.
zh: 他背叛了自己的承諾，把發生在她身上的不幸編成了一個故事，供人取樂。

en: “You’re a monster,” Jerry says.
zh: 「你是個怪物。」傑瑞說。

en: The knife.
Go for the knife.
zh: 去拿起那把刀。」

en: But if he goes for it, and fails, then Eva is the one who pays.
zh: 但如果他去了，失敗了，那麼伊娃就得為此埋單。

en: “Maybe,” Hans says.
zh: 「可能吧。」漢斯說，「但我們今天過得很值，對吧？

en: We did get a killer off the street.”
zh: 我們在街上找到了一個殺人兇手。」

en: “Is that why we hung him out the window?
zh: 「這就是我們要把他掛在窗外的原因嗎？

en: Because you wanted to kill him?”
zh: 因為你本來就想殺了他？」

en: “We had to, buddy. He’d seen my face.
zh: 「我們不得不那樣做，夥計，他看到了我的臉。

en: Despite everything, Jerry, I really was trying to help you there.”
zh: 話雖如此，傑瑞，我真的也很想幫助你。」

en: “Why?
zh: 「為什麼？

en: Because you didn’t want somebody else framing me for their crimes?
zh: 就因為你不想讓別人來構陷我？

en: Was this some sort of twisted contest?”
zh: 這難道是場扭曲的比賽嗎？」

en: And before you ask about his wife, she’s not going to remember anything, clearly.
zh: 你可以去問他的妻子，她什麼都不會記得。

en: “You don’t have to hurt her.”
zh: 「你不必傷害她。」

en: “We’ll see.”
zh: 「那就等著看看吧。」

en: “All that stuff about the police going easy on us, that was bullshit,” Jerry says.
zh: 「說警察會對我們網開一面，這是無稽之談。」傑瑞說。

en: “Just write the note, Jerry. And don’t mention Suzan.
zh: 「只是寫懺悔書就好，傑瑞，也不要提蘇姍。

en: We don’t want to complicate the issue.
zh: 我們不想讓問題複雜化。

en: Now hurry up before I change my mind and decide to go and pay Eva a visit.
zh: 快點兒，趁我還沒有改變主意，決定去拜訪伊娃之前。

en: And make sure you sell it. You’re not writing to save your own life, you’re writing to save your daughter’s.”
zh: 要知道，你不是為了拯救你自己而寫，你是為了拯救你女兒。」
